verses.name: Psalms 21:1
verses.text: The king shall joy in thy strength, O Lord; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!

verses.name: Psalms 21:2
verses.text: Thou hast given him his heart’s desire, and hast not withholden the request of his lips. Selah.

verses.name: Psalms 21:3
verses.text: For thou preventest him with the blessings of goodness: thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.

verses.name: Psalms 21:4
verses.text: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest it him, even length of days for ever and ever.

verses.name: Psalms 21:5
verses.text: His glory is great in thy salvation: honour and majesty hast thou laid upon him.

verses.name: Psalms 21:6
verses.text: For thou hast made him most blessed for ever: thou hast made him exceeding glad with thy countenance.

verses.name: Psalms 21:7
verses.text: For the king trusteth in the Lord, and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.

verses.name: Psalms 21:8
verses.text: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies: thy right hand shall find out those that hate thee.

verses.name: Psalms 21:9
verses.text: Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger: the Lord shall swallow them up in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.

verses.name: Psalms 21:10
verses.text: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.

verses.name: Psalms 21:11
verses.text: For they intended evil against thee: they imagined a mischievous device, which they are not able to perform.

verses.name: Psalms 21:12
verses.text: Therefore shalt thou make them turn their back, when thou shalt make ready thine arrows upon thy strings against the face of them.

verses.name: Psalms 21:13
verses.text: Be thou exalted, Lord, in thine own strength: so will we sing and praise thy power.
